page.title: 01LANDMARKS
page.content: Crich Stand is an inland lighthouse standing 63 feet high and 995.59 feet above sea level. It was built as a memorial to the Sherwood Foresters who died in the First World War. The Stand is open all year round for six days a week. Up to 20,000 people visit it in a year. From it you can see seven counties _ Derbyshire, Nottinghamshire, Leicestershire, Staffordshire, Cheshire,Yorkshire and Lincolnshire. The car park charges are Cars 20p, Buses 60p,Motor bikes 20p and to go up the Tower it is 10p. Stand Sunday is on the first Sunday in July when a Service is held attended by members of the Sherwood Foresters Regiment.
